title: Bay of Sails
text:
Bay of Sails () is a shallow indentation in the coast of <a href="Victoria%20Land">Victoria Land</a> between <a href="Spike%20Cape">Spike Cape</a> and <a href="Gneiss%20Point">Gneiss Point</a>. The bay is the end point of <a href="Scheuren%20Stream">Scheuren Stream</a>, which carries meltwater from <a href="Wilson%20Piedmont%20Glacier">Wilson Piedmont Glacier</a>.
The name was first suggested by the Western Geological Party of the <a href="British%20Antarctic%20Expedition%2C%201910%E2%80%9313">British Antarctic Expedition, 1910–13</a>, which erected makeshift sails on their man-drawn sledge while sledging across the ice at the mouth of the bay, thereby increasing their speed.
